channel.title: People can connect to my Server...but I can't
channel.description:
So I'm having trouble connecting to my server.. I finally got the ports forwarded and router set up, and the no-ip set up...
Then I downloaded a driver for my desktop ethernet adapter, so I could go wired instead of wireless. It worked, and I'm wired now, but connected, but now my server is having troubles again. I can't connect, but everyone else with my same client (which I didn't modify from theirs!), can connect.. I tried changing the IPs in the client, because everyone else with the same problem got the same replies, saying that it needed to have a certain IP, in this case, my local IP.
I tried changing that, nothing happened. I report forwarded, because I noticed when I switched to wired, my firewall came up, so I redid uTorrent's Ports to 43594, and then I turned the firewall off, added exceptions for uTorrent, and for the ports that Simple Port Forwarding added. They're in my router settings for both TPC/UDP, the same as before.. My No-IP DUC is still running... and it's updated with the most current IP..
What did I do wrong???

It let me log in according to the 127.0.0.1
I wonder why it changed like that? .-.

++REP btw!
Thanks!

-Kleber
